name: Delta King

reviews.text: There were average things and interesting things about this stay. Delta King is a paddleboat, like what Mark Twain used to ride on. The day I arrived there was a large stage for a wedding being set up. My room was very small, not even a dresser. And the knob on the air conditioner was busted. But the antique flavor of the place added some semblance of charm, so it wasn't horrible. Glad I'm not 6 foot!
reviews.title: Antique, Classy, Noisy

likes.disliked: — Tiny, but that's expected on a boat. Ships are not known for space.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was fairly good. When I wanted sugar for the free coffee served, the guy went out of his way to get some for me. A woman at the front desk forgot I was a guest, despite my distinctive SF Giants cap through the trip.
reviews.title: great, novel hotel

likes.liked: — the fact it was a paddle speamer

reviews.text: Neat little TV set, full cable, HD. Chain toilet was cute. Tiny shower for a quick clean-up. They're environmentally conscious, where I think all hotels now are giving guests a choice of washing towels and bedding daily or just what's needed to save water.
reviews.title: Fun place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Saturday night I was woken by a fireworks display! That was cool, only lasted ten minutes, pleasantly unexpected.
reviews.title: Unique accomodations, but noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most positive point was their Housekeeping staff. I left for a few hours and when I returned, the sheets were turned and little squares of chocolate were on the pillows! Cool!
reviews.title: The "great" escape!

likes.liked: — the fact it was a paddle speamer

reviews.title: Wonderful and Charming
reviews.text: The rooms are delightful, the river view is fantastic, food is fabulous, staff is attentive. This is a unique historic property and you won't find another one like it. You stay on the beautifully remodeled river boat. There is a theatre, restaurant and lounge also on board. This is a must-stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently, I took a short, but memorable trip to Sacramento. By far, the highlight of my trip was spending three wonderful nights aboard the beautiful Delta King Hotel. I cannot begin to explain how helpful and accommodating every member of the staff is. Everyone, from the front desk manager to the valet, are kind, caring, and deeply committed to excellent customer service. The entire front desk staff are to be commended for their exceptional, gracious service!
reviews.title: Exceptional Stay on Delta King!
Avoid at all cost
reviews.text: A lot of care and pride have gone into maintaining and caring for the lovely Delta King Hotel...and it shows!!! This hotel is such a wonderful alternative to staying at a large, impersonal hotel elsewhere. I was made to feel like a welcome guest at a friend's home.
This beautiful boat is truly a treasure and I look forward to returning in the very near future for a longer stay!!!
reviews.title: The Out of Towners

likes.liked: — bar,food was ok but overpriced in their restraurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms, are tiny, dusty, they smell, the bathrooms are made for midgets. We originally booked for 2 nights, but after we saw the room we were both like, we are not staying here. We were charged for 1 night even though we did'nt stay there at all. This place sucks. I won't recomend this place to even my enemies.
reviews.title: Great Boat, Friendly Service

likes.disliked: — no room service but they were happy to bring us a pot of coffee in the morning

reviews.text: We thought it would be a terrific experience to stay on a real riverboat so I checked on-line reviews. The reviews were generally favorable, so I went ahead and booked a "deluxe" room. The web site showed spacious rooms with lots of windows (I know, portholes). Yes, I know better than to trust such photos completely. Anyway, the room was the size of a moderate closet, with barely enough room to get in the door or make one's way around the bed. As a claustrophobic, I was surprised I didn't totally panic. The room was dingy and none too clean (all kinds of stuff on the walls, etc.) The remote control for the television, which was maybe one foot from the bottom of the bed, did not change channels. The furniture was from the 70's and decrepit. One of the bedside lamps had no light bulb. The bathroom was not terribly clean (gunky sink fixtures, dirty grout, etc.) and smelled horrible (as old boats do). Every time the bathroom door got left open I had to close it quickly. The exterior lighting was on all night and the shutters did not help a lot. I was totally miserable. If I go back to Sacramento I will surely stay at the Embassy Suites, where I've stayed before and been delighted, with a beautiful view overlooking the river, for the same amount of money.
reviews.title: Absolutely miserable

likes.liked: — The view of the boat from the dock

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights on the Delta King and loved every minute. The room was small, as expected on an old steamer, but we still had a bath/shower and more than enough room for the two of us.
reviews.title: Great honeymoon venue...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let's face it - you don't spend your holiday in your room anyway!
reviews.title: Very Quaint, something different

likes.liked: — The atmosphere, It was something different
likes.disliked: — didn't have anything I didn't like

reviews.text: The staff were helpful and friendly, everywhere was clean, and we felt that we were being really spoilt. We have stayed in all types of hotel, of all grades, but we really enjoyed the old style charm and luxury of this hotel.
reviews.title: Extreemly Cool!
Return trip, still lots of fun & energy
reviews.text: The location was also great, right in the heart of old town Sacramento, and a stroll from the new part. We ate one night in the crab restaurant down the road - which was a must see!

The rooms are very small as is the bathroom. Also, since it is a refurbished river vessel, built in 1927, it is not up to current building codes (this is noted by signs all over the hotel). There is a very nice lounge/bar at the back of the hotel which overlooks the Delta. There is also a restaurant on the main floor (with above average prices). The staff was very nice and accommodating.
reviews.title: NIce find in Old Sacramento

likes.disliked: — The room tips slightly to one side (although it IS a river vessel sitting in the water).

reviews.text: That being said, this hotel is in a great location for shopping and dining in Old Town Sacramento. My friends and I stayed there after local river rafting (an hour away) and found the restaurants/bars to be lively and busy during our Sunday night stay.
reviews.title: Dirty and Smelling

reviews.text: Since the hotel has no elevator, it is probably not a good place for older or disabled travelers to consider without obtaining further information from the hotel directly.
reviews.title: Nice place but felt a little duped

likes.liked: — A fun and quirky alternative to the standard hotel accommodations.
likes.disliked: — Was misled regarding the price of the room.

reviews.title: Wonderful experience
reviews.text: Shoe box size cabin, filthy venue, people smoking on the decks, drunk patrons pushing their way through narrow gangways, our experience was like a nightmare!

reviews.title: Very cramped, best for small people with no luggage...
reviews.text: The worst part was when we went to see "Suspects", a mystery comedy that was not funny at all: The smell of sewage combined with the heat of the room made it very uncomfortable. It felt as we were inside a septic tank! This made us sick and we left in the middle of the show.

description: The Delta King is an authentic, historic, and permanently moored riverboat on the Sacramento River in Downtown Old Sacramento, Ca. In addition to the two restaurants, the Delta King has 44 AAA 3-Diamond rated staterooms with prepared to order hot breakfast daily, two dinner theatres, a wine school, and wedding & conference facilities. Sacramento Bee says: Pilothouse Restaurant is a must dine destination.
